title: AudioReader is now run in a thread pool, in the hope of making things more responsive.

AudioReader is now run in a thread pool, in the hope of making things more responsive.

Frames are still being skipped in the emulator when
recording is started/stopped.

title: create thread-safe AudioRecord class

create thread-safe AudioRecord class

At least I think it's thread safe. AudioRecorder now
uses it. Getting a few too many interrupted exceptions,
but it passes all tests and works.

title: Fix no playback on Android 4.1.2 (and possibly all Android < 4.4)
message:
Fix no playback on Android 4.1.2 (and possibly all Android < 4.4)

Have to call AudioRecord.read() before stop(), otherwise
no audio data gets copied.

title: Merge branch 'save-buffer' into save-buffer-merge.
message:
Merge branch 'save-buffer' into save-buffer-merge.

Deleted fragment stuff in the process. There seems to be
no way to tell if the app is closing due to a configuration
change or if the system is closing it. Therefore, I may as
well just save the buffer to file whenever either happens.
